competitive_intel:
## Available Competitive Intelligence

- Competition description: `../research/description.md`
- 5 top kernel notebooks in `../research/kernels/`

data_findings.finding: This is a 2D bin packing optimization problem: fit Christmas tree shapes (15-vertex polygons) into smallest square boxes for n=1 to 200 trees. Score = sum of (side_length^2 / n) for all n. Lower is better.

Key optimization tools used: bbox3 binary optimizer, shake_public binary for local optimization, fix_direction for rotation tightening. These are external compiled binaries that optimize tree placements.
Rotation tightening technique: After placing trees, optimize the global rotation angle of the entire configuration to minimize bounding box. Uses scipy.optimize.minimize_scalar on convex hull points.
Tree shape: 15-vertex polygon with trunk (0.15 wide, 0.2 tall), base tier (0.7 wide), middle tier (0.4 wide), top tier (0.25 wide), tip at y=0.8. Position defined by center of trunk top.
